result.execSummary:
The defendant Torrion R Spivey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Torrion R Spivey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Torrion R Spivey in court with attorney Eugene J Dietzler.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
   On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), an unclassified misdemanor.  Court struck the Second or Subsequent penalty enhancer.  As to the amended charge:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 days
 in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served, for a time served disposition.  Costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge shall be paid by 5-12-15, or if not paid a civil judgment to be entered.  
-

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  In one year, defendant may apply for expungement.  Defendant must provide proof of enrollment in school and have no new charges.

Defendant Torrion R Spivey in court with attorney Eugene J Dietzler.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Paul Hauer.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  The State made a disclosure regarding Attorney Dietzler.  The Court had a discussion with the defendant about the State's disclosure.  The defendant will proceed with Attorney Dietzler as counsel.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on May 12, 2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 26.
Filed by the State:  Witness List, Proposed Jury Instructions, Motion in Limine.
Letter From ADA Paul M. Hauer, dated 3-18-2014
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (17 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 20, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Torrion R Spivey in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Case rescheduled to 3-14-14, 8:30.  Defense counsel and DA's office notified by phone.

Defendant Torrion R Spivey in court with attorney Eugene Dietzler.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Stephan E. Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Steven Jegen-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #11CF1943 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  

Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
$150.00 cash bail to be returned to the poster (remitter).  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription (No drugs).

Defendant Torrion R Spivey in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
